newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Singapore PM calls for greater EU-Asia understanding.
newsitem.headline: Singapore PM calls for greater EU-Asia understanding.

text.p: Singapore Prime Minister Goh Chok Tong on Monday called for greater understanding of cultural differences between Europe and Asia, saying cooperation was the key to advancing relations.

Speaking at Belgium's Royal Insitute of International Affairs, Goh said the European Union and Asia were two corners of a triangle completed by the United States. This triangle was essential for global economic harmony, he said.
"While transatlantic ties between Europe and North America and transpacific ties between North America and East Asia were strong, institutional linkages between Europe and Asia were absent," he said.
But he added that ASEM (the Asia-Europe Meeting started last year) was a great step towards completing the triangle.

"The world will benefit in many ways from this strengthened partnership," he said. "It will create a strong triangular relationship among the three regions of economic power ... (provide) potential for synergy between Asia and Europe ... and make a joint contribuition to global peace and stability in the new century."

Goh, visiting for two days during which he will meet senior Belgiam officials as well as European Commission President Jacques Santer, cited the 16th Century examples of European explorers Matteo Ricci and Michele Ruggieni as models for cooperation.

The Jesuit missionaries, said Goh "creatively and wisely adapted themselves to local circumstance by adopting Chinese dress, names and language, thus making themselves acceptable to their host before imparting their knowledge.
"Now, Asian businessmen are copying the Jesuits, by donning Western dress, speaking Western languages and -- for some -- even adopting Western names in order to do business.
